result.execSummary:
The defendant Valerie J Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample and pay related surchage. Pay court costs and DNA surcharge by the end of probation; non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

- No violations of State or Federal Law that rise to the level of probable cause.
- Absolute sobriety.
- No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- Continue mental health assessments.
- No Contact with Goodwill on Oakland Ave

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Valerie J Green

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 150 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 3 days. IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1 (one) year.   
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
-Absolute sobriety 
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription
-Continue mental health assessments
-No contact with Goodwill on Oakland Ave
-Court costs are to be paid by the end of probation; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by the end of probation; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Valerie J Green in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.Case calendared for projected guilty plea. Defendant is in the hospital, proof must be provided. As a result, defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Valerie J Green in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record.    Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch  37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Goodwill at 2830 N Oakland Ave

Defendant Valerie J Green in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Valerie J Green in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
